actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to protect the privacy of telephone users.

summary.text: Telephone Privacy Act of 1991 - Amends the Electronic Communications Privacy Act of 1986 to permit the use of caller identification systems (i.e., devices which allow the recipient of a telephone call to determine individually identifying information about the caller or the originating number) if the provider enables the telephone call originator to block receipt of the identifying information. Authorizes civil suits against providers who provide caller identification systems to call recipients without providing blocking capability to call originators.

titles.title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to protect the privacy of telephone users.
